fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-32707].
  {panel}

There's a blank space where the line should be appearing in JIRA Issues Macro when exporting a page to PDF. This is happening on the top line only. The rest of the lines are displaying properly. 

Looking at the page everything appears to be working properly:

!page.png!

*However*, when we export the page to PDF, it seems that the top line under JIRA's custom fields are not showing up:

!pdf_export.png!

It only seems to appear under JIRA's system fields. This started to happening only a few weeks ago. This can be reproduced by exporting the page to PDF by going through the page itself or by exporting it from the space admin area (Content Tools > Export > PDF > Custom Export > Page).
fields.summary: Line missing from PDF export using JIRA Issues Macro
Ability to expand / collapse the Attachments macro like a page tree
Convenient edit buttom

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-32703].
  {panel}

From the previous Attachment macro (in Confluence 5.0), user can easily access the menu/options on the right side of the attachments:
!https://confluence.atlassian.com/download/attachments/329979993/Attachments_macro.png?version=1&modificationDate=1361222213439&api=v2!

In the latest Confluence version (with the latest Attachment macro), this has changed where the menu/options are located at the bottom of the attachment. If there is a long list of attachment versions, user had to scroll down to the bottom to access the menu/options which would be inconvenient:
!https://confluence.atlassian.com/download/attachments/139378/Attachments_macro052.png?version=2&modificationDate=1391561448538&api=v2!

If not, we should provide options to avoid Confluence displaying all versions of an edited files when it is expanded.
fields.summary: Revert back the layout presentation of the new Attachment Macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-32698].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
The live search macro doesn't return a search result unless the search query is in full word or part of the word is followed by asterisk (i.e. 'tes*') as opposed to the Search function in the top bar. In some cases the live search macro needs five characters before it can dispaly suggested results. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new space
# Add Live Search Macro
# Try to search part of a word in Live Search Macro

h3. Expected Results
* The Live Search Macro should return search result even if the search query is not a full word.

h3. Actual Results
* The Live search macro doesn't return a search result unless the search query is in full word.
fields.summary: Live Search Macro doesn't show result unless the search query is in full word

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-32692].
  {panel}



There should be a built in configuration setting that allows an Admin to simply disable the "Forgot Password?" functionality without having to add styles and modify templates.

We're currently utilizing the solutions in the workarounds provided below, but we'd like to see this functionality built into Confluence.

Known Workarounds:
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/102042/remove-forgot-paassword-link-in-confluence

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF41/Disabling+Password+management+from+User
fields.summary: Add a configuration setting that allows an Admin to disable the "Forgot Password?" functionality.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-32668].
  {panel}

Hi Guys,

We love the page history feature in Confluence, however, we'd love it even more if we could have dot versions (or subversions) of documents as when we export them and send externally we have to use the version number and sending a document that has version number 24 or 62 because of minor tweaks doesn't look great?

Any help would be great.

Scroll Versions was noted as a add-on to deliver this functionality, but it doesn't work in OnDemand - can it be added to Confluence OnDemand as an option (paid or unpaid)?
fields.summary: Version control in OnDemand

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-32667].
  {panel}

*Steps to reproduce:*

1) Create a Team Space (Spaces > Create Space > Team Space.
2) Add three members.
3) Save it. You'll see the profile picture of all 3 members in the home page.
4) Then add more members to the Team Space (Space Tools > Permissions > Individual Users). 
5) Give them all the permissions.
6) Go back to the Home Page of the Team Space. 
7) Just the 3 members added on the creation of the space will be there. So basically the Home Page is not updated after adding more members. This give the wrong information for the users, making they think that just 3 people are part of that team.

*Workaround:*

1) Edit the home page of the team space.
2) Add the other users profile manually.
a) Add more columns to the table.
b) Copy the content from one of the other members.
c) Paste and make the necessary changes (profile picture and username below).
fields.summary: Home Page of Team Space not updating members information
Count report from a confluence page/table

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-32650].
  {panel}

I, and most of my team hit this pretty much every week.

To reproduce:
1. Start typing {include ... and bring up the dialog box.
2. Paste a URL from a page you have open in another tab such as http://confluence.blah.blah/display/RSYS/DevOps+Weekly+Reports+-+2014-02-14
3. include-page is stupid - it doesn't recognize that this an addressable page.
4. Painstakingly remove the http://... prefix, change all "+" to " " until the link is acceptable to confluence.

Expected:
1. Confluence can work ot what to do with an absolute URL
2. (nice to have but not required) a much better page selection widget with
 a. selection of last N pages you've visited (like jira does)
 b. autocompletion with incremental suggestion list narrowing
fields.summary: Include-Page macro is stupid
Customize Shared Links bookmarklet

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-32634].
  {panel}

1. Open the create dialog
2. choose anything except 'blank page'
3. every one of these actions attempts to use 'setItem()', and put something in local storage.
4. If the local storage quote is exceeded, a JS error occurs, and the dialog just sits there, spinning. The user can now no longer create anything except blank pages.

We should handle this error properly, rather than make confluence unusable.
fields.summary: Create Dialog becomes unusable when chrome local storage quota is exceeded

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-32625].
  {panel}

Suggested improvement: 
* requester needs to fill in mandatory "justification" field before he/she is allowed to submit the access request
* email notification sent to the person supposed to grant access to target page contains the justification text and requester's email address or any other kind of info which can be easily used to uniquely identify and contact the requester.

The complaint from user is as follows:
At some point I started to receive emails from "<Firstname Lastname> (Confluence)" <confluence.mail@####.###> with subject "\[Confluence\] <Firstname Lastname> requested access to <some page>".
Although this approach may seem pretty elegant to the requestor, but I as the request receiver feel very uncomfortable about that, as the request contains no justification/explanation so the next thing I'd need to do is to contact the requestor, but my reply will go eventually to confluence.mail@####.###. It means I need then start identifying the correct email address of the requestor.
fields.summary: Optional "reason" field for users to fill when requesting access to a page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-32610].
  {panel}

h3. Summary of Bug

When using the JIRA Issue Macro, for custom fields that deals with Versions, the ID of the value will be shown instead of the value itself

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a custom field in JIRA that deals with versions(either 'Version Picker' or 'Multi Version Picker')
# Configure an applink between JIRA and Confluence, and then try using the JIRA Issue Macro to show the version fields
# The ID will be shown instead of the value

This is the proper value :

!version value.png|thumbnail!

This is the result shown in the macro :

!version picker.png|thumbnail!

h3. Additional Info

* This seems to only occur with custom fields, and does not affect system fields (Fix Version/s, for example)
* Tested with Confluence 5.4.1, JIRA 6.1
fields.summary: JIRA Issue Macro shows the ID instead of the value
Moving Spaces

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-32592].
  {panel}

There are many requests for solving the problem of email notification storms.

Will Atlassian put the effort in to summarise these, close all the others with links to the new single issue, and allow voting on that one issue.

As it is, many of the requests have been arbitrarily "Resolved" as Not Needed, with not even links to the open issues. (How it is "resolved" is beyond me. Closed yes, resolved, no way. leads to false reporting of resolved issues.)

I am classing this as a major loss of function as comments are very clear that the notification-storms are a major hassle, very annoying for users, impacting acceptance of the wiki, leading to all sorts of detrimental work-arounds.
fields.summary: Many requests for solving problem of email notification storms

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-32584].
  {panel}

Have had some reports from other tech writers that pages in CAC are not displaying correctly, and when you click in the page, it fixes itself. 

Strange spacing between words and missing words was reported by [~wthompson].   [~pwatson] reports seeing similar behaviour.   [~npye] reports font size issues. 

I have seen page headings display with incorrect fonts (fairly regularly). 

[~jsoderstrom] was able to replicate the behaviour by leaving a tab open for a long time,  again it corrected itself when you clicked to switch focus to that tab. 

Would be worth investigating if this is something specific to our custom CSS, or whether it affects any custom CSS in a space (and might therefore be affecting customers also).
fields.summary: Stylesheet not always appears correctly on CAC pages

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-32550].
  {panel}

Like any wiki the usefulness of the content is equal to the time and enthusiasm to put data into the portal. As a company we have had numerous false starts at creating an environment that is embraced by the employees (share point, Wiki's of various types, smb shares etc). All technologies we have tried have failed due to them being unstructured across product lines and teams, and have eventually been abandoned or become messy black holes, from which we can never mine information.

In moving to the Atlasssian suite of tools/products we have  decided to take a proactive effort in templating spaces for the product lines, to provide common look and feel and familiarity to the users. In creating these spaces we have seen many challenges some of which we have in part solved with 3rd party plugins and macros (not ideal but workable). however there is one feature that was not solvable and create's significant work when using the space template to create new spaces and maintain ongoing.

Many of our pages contain JQL queries tying JIRA to CONFLUENCE Pages. Though the queries are 90% the same across product/project (s) fields such as 'project' and 'fix version' are not for example. In an ideal world it should be possible to create variables in a confluence space or in-tree parent page which is available to all child pages. The variables could then be usable in JQL queries.  or Label definitions and ultimately plugin and macros etc.

This feature would save our company alone a world of hurt and time.
fields.summary: JQL and Page variables
New variables in a Blueprint not used when creating a page

Toggle "show user profile pics" in "Recently Updated" macro not working

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-32536].
  {panel}

Hi,

On the login panel, there is a "user email" field, which is input type="text".
However, since HTML5, there is an input type="email".
This is basically a text input, but the browser will perform some validation over the text entered.
Browsers which don't support this type will default to input type="text", so no regression if you start to use it: only benefits.

It looks like you currently only have server side check for this so this will not interfere with any validation Javascript code you might had for this field.
Even if the field's title is "email", using a username might be valid too?
If so, it would make sense to not use this input type in the login panel.
But IMHO it should be used on the sign up panel, as I think here you're expecting a valid email address in all cases here.
fields.summary: Using input type=email

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-32535].
  {panel}

Hi,

I started to use Atlassian products recently.
Quite good :)
But, as a web developer I realized few things might be improved (not a big issue though, but I thought it would be worth to let you know. Maybe you already know this exists and you have a good reason for not using it, but just in case...)
One of them is the file upload for profile picture (in Confluence, Jira, ...) which use an input type="file" without accept attribute.
This standard HTML attribute let you specify the filter of the file picker (which is "All files" by default).
Using accept="image/*" will add a filter to show only images files. The "All files" filter is supposed to be still available, but not the default.
accept can also support file extensions, and mime type, but these aren't well supported on all browsers (while image/* is supported on major browsers, except IE).

You can safely use this attribute: in case user's browser doesn't support it, it will simply ignore it and your product will look like it is today, without any regression.

IMHO it would be nice to use it in your products, and it doesn't sound difficult to implement.
fields.summary: accept="image/*" for updating profile picture
Page properties report: sort by number of likes or comments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-32533].
  {panel}

It would be very useful to have utility/tool similar like [Stash Backup Client|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.stash.backup.client] in Confluence.

The Backup Client can be used to backup and restore a Confluence server.

The backup client generates a full backup of a Confluence server and can be used in regular, scheduled backups.

The restore client restores a Confluence server from a backup file. It can restore to a new database if the original database is not available (for instance, in case of a hardware failure).
fields.summary: Confluence Backup Client

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-32529].
  {panel}

Steps to produce bug:

# Create a page.
# In the editor, create a bullet list.
# Enter some text and click enter. A second bullet point is created.
# Insert a random text  and insert an element which has nodeType=1 after that. Ex: Element has nodetype=1 a bold text or icon emotion icon
# Make sure there is no any element, even spaces (hidden_char, no_break_white_space,   ...), after the element (nodeType=1)
Sometimes you should press DELETE key to make sure there is no hidden space after the element (nodeType=1) or may use Developer Tool of browser to inspect DOM and make sure the nodeType=1 is the last of line.
# Try to put cursor after the element (nodeType=1). 
# Press backspace to delete the element (nodeType=1)
# Backspace works incorrectly: the cursor jumps at the beginning of <li> and the remove <li> element
Expect: When pressing backspace key should remove the element before cursor (in this case it is the element nodeType=1)

Related ticket: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFDEV-21873
fields.summary: Backspace to delete an element which is at the end of list - <li> element
Attachments macro to include a parameter for Download All

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-32525].
  {panel}

When a page/blog has too many JIRA Issues Macros, the page times out as Confluence tries to make JIRA calls for all the macros.

The correct behaviour should be to call JIRA asynchronously and timeout the individual macros, not the page.

The number of calls that JIRA can handle should also be considered. We should avoid overloading JIRA.

h3. Workaround:

Split out the JIRA Issues Macro onto separate pages.

Also avoid using functionality that avoids loading multiple pages at once, such as viewing the blogs posts of a space, as this will trigger many calls to JIRA simultaneously.

h3. Fix
Upgrade to [JIRA Macros version 5.5.4|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/confluence.extra.jira]. This was bundled in Confluence 5.5.

h3. Important note:
This fix makes use of JIRA request batching which is only available since JIRA *6.0.29*. For the older version of JIRA (5+), this fix has no effect.
fields.summary: Pages/Blogs timeout if they contain too many JIRA Issues Macros
Attachments Macro - missing columns for comments and labels
Allow blueprints to be enabled in a space when it is disabled globally

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-32508].
  {panel}

Currently the status macro allows the user to set a colour, and a text string. This fields are independent.

It is a common use case to have a particular string associated with a specific colour. For example, green="Done" and red="Incomplete".

It would be useful if the macro could store these associations, so that when a user changes the colour from red to green, the text is changed automatically.

See discussion on CONF-26322
fields.summary: Status macro allows predefined text strings to be associated with each colour
Disable Workbox for Anonymous users on mobile
Should be able to add unmerged row from row with vertically merged cells

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-32499].
  {panel}

By highlighting some text on a Confluence page, you should be able to create a new child page with the title from the selected text:

!new-page-from-selection.png!

The selected text should link through to the child page.

In this case, a new child page named *Branding guide* would be created and the selected text would link through to the child page.
fields.summary: Create new child page from selected text / highlight panel

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-32495].
  {panel}

Hi, 

For most cases, we use the default permission scheme on Confluence with minimal configuration. This is done obviously on purpose to reduce setup cost going forward (keeping defaults), by moving most of the management to active directory. 

For example, a group called "Developers" in active directory should by default have "users" access (imagine it as a role). At the moment, the group "developers" is imported from LDAP, then the permission is replicated on "global permissions", then done again for each space. Even this is not perfect as there may be page specific permissions to replicate.

Rather, if there is a functionality to add "developers" group to "users", then it will simply inherit all "user" groups and its associated accesses.

This is extremely beneficial for large enterprises where you have separate teams managing confluence and the active directory. When a new employee joins the company, our single sign-on process for all our other systems means the only setup that needs to be made is @ active directory and all the employee's access is replicated across the system. 

Furthermore, when managing AD, sometimes one would like to split certain groups into multiple sub groups; this should ideally be a case of adding that new group to another local group rather than replicating permissions across the site (which is the case with ours as we're trying to learn and adopt confluence + with a growing company).
fields.summary: Nested Local Groups
Allow assignee to be selected when creating a JIRA issue via Confluence
Movable Overlay Dialogues
Changing format should obey current selection.
Google Map Macro not working with Expand Macro
Improve labels autocomplete control
The Confluence editor should strip markup and classes when it is pasted into the page
ability to display (in a space banner or the like) a list of space admins, automatically generated
Pull profile info from LDAP
Allow Administrator to Completely Disable the Automatic Macro Migration from Wiki Markup to XHTML
Reference to old forums in "Building Confluence From Source Code"
Add global template/blueprint functionality to administrators in Confluence OnDemand
Look and Feel for anonymous users

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-32457].
  {panel}

There are strange behaviors with quickedit. Most of the issues revolve around using the editor toolbar in quick edit (not in full edit).
These have been confirmed in 5.4.1. (as long as quick-edit is enabled) and possibly go back to 5.1

Using options like bold now adds additional blank lines after the content
!bold.gif|width=100%!

When attempting to user the list toolbar buttons on quick-edit of a blank page I'm seeing the following in the logs, coming out of 'com.atlassian.plugins.tinymce:atlassian-rte-javascript-tinymce-extensions' 'jscripts/tiny_mce/plugins/lists/editor_plugin_src.js'. The button will not work again until the user clicks inside the body

!number.gif|width=100%!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-32456].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:
1. Відкрити додаток helloworld.exe
2. Відкрити консоль ("cmd" або "виполонить"), 
3. В командний рядок  консолі введіть "telnet 127.0.0.1" і  виберіть будь-який порт  окрім  (4010) натисніть enter
Actual result:
Сервер не  підключився до вибраного порту.
Expected result:
Сервер має підключитись до вибраного порту.
fields.summary: g1230HW1 Додаток (helloworld.exe) не приймає інші порти крім 4010

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-32455].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:
1. Відкрити додаток helloworld.exe два рази

Actual result:
Другий по запиту додаток зациклюється

Expected result:
Після другого включення показати помилку "Сервер вже увімкнутий"
fields.summary: g1230HW1 Не коректна робота  двох додатків(helloworld.exe)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-32454].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:
1. Відкрити додаток helloworld.exe
2. Відкрити консоль ("cmd" або "виполонить"), 5 разів
3. В командний рядок кожної консолі введіть "telnet 127.0.0.1 4010" і натисніть  enter

Actual result:
Сервер не витримує більше двох підключень.

Expected result:
Сервер має виконувати до п'яти підключень.
fields.summary: g1230HW1 Додаток (helloworld.exe) не приймає 5 з'єднань
Confluence with MySQL should support utf8mb4 encoding
